memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, cugraph_graph_t *graph, const cugraph_vertex_pairs_t *vertex_pairs, bool_t use_weight, bool_t do_expensive_check, cugraph_similarity_result_t **result, cugraph_error_t **error)
memberdef.name: cugraph_jaccard_coefficients

detaileddescription.para: Compute the similarity for the specified vertex_pairs
Note that Jaccard similarity must run on a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for accessing resources
Pointer to graph
Vertex pair for input
If true consider the edge weight in the graph, if false use an edge weight of 1
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).
Opaque pointer to similarity results
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS

memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, cugraph_graph_t *graph, const cugraph_vertex_pairs_t *vertex_pairs, bool_t use_weight, bool_t do_expensive_check, cugraph_similarity_result_t **result, cugraph_error_t **error)

detaileddescription.para: Compute the similarity for the specified vertex_pairs
Note that Sorensen similarity must run on a symmetric graph.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the similarity for the specified vertex_pairs
Note that overlap similarity must run on a symmetric graph.

Pointer to graph

memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, cugraph_graph_t *graph, const cugraph_type_erased_device_array_view_t *vertices, bool_t use_weight, size_t topk, bool_t do_expensive_check, cugraph_similarity_result_t **result, cugraph_error_t **error)
memberdef.name: cugraph_all_pairs_jaccard_coefficients

detaileddescription.para: Compute the similarity for all vertex pairs derived from the two-hop neighbors of an optional specified vertex list. This function will identify the two-hop neighbors of the specified vertices (all vertices in the graph if not specified) and compute similarity for those vertices.
If the topk parameter is specified then the result will only contain the top k highest scoring results.
Note that Jaccard similarity must run on a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for accessing resources
Pointer to graph
Vertex list for input. If null then compute based on all vertices in the graph.
If true consider the edge weight in the graph, if false use an edge weight of 1
Specify how many answers to return. Specifying SIZE_MAX will return all values.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).
Opaque pointer to similarity results
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS

memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, cugraph_graph_t *graph, const cugraph_type_erased_device_array_view_t *vertices, bool_t use_weight, size_t topk, bool_t do_expensive_check, cugraph_similarity_result_t **result, cugraph_error_t **error)
memberdef.name: cugraph_all_pairs_sorensen_coefficients

briefdescription.para: Perform All Pairs Sorensen similarity computation.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the similarity for all vertex pairs derived from the two-hop neighbors of an optional specified vertex list. This function will identify the two-hop neighbors of the specified vertices (all vertices in the graph if not specified) and compute similarity for those vertices.
If the topk parameter is specified then the result will only contain the top k highest scoring results.
Note that Sorensen similarity must run on a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for accessing resources
Pointer to graph
Vertex list for input. If null then compute based on all vertices in the graph.
If true consider the edge weight in the graph, if false use an edge weight of 1
Specify how many answers to return. Specifying SIZE_MAX will return all values.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).
Opaque pointer to similarity results
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS

memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, cugraph_graph_t *graph, const cugraph_type_erased_device_array_view_t *vertices, bool_t use_weight, size_t topk, bool_t do_expensive_check, cugraph_similarity_result_t **result, cugraph_error_t **error)
memberdef.name: cugraph_all_pairs_overlap_coefficients

briefdescription.para: Perform All Pairs overlap similarity computation.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the similarity for all vertex pairs derived from the two-hop neighbors of an optional specified vertex list. This function will identify the two-hop neighbors of the specified vertices (all vertices in the graph if not specified) and compute similarity for those vertices.
If the topk parameter is specified then the result will only contain the top k highest scoring results.
Note that overlap similarity must run on a symmetric graph.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for accessing resources
Pointer to graph
Vertex list for input. If null then compute based on all vertices in the graph.
If true consider the edge weight in the graph, if false use an edge weight of 1
Specify how many answers to return. Specifying SIZE_MAX will return all values.
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).
Opaque pointer to similarity results
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS
